content:
Call for participation

Dear all

The 5th International Conference on Applied Category Theory will take place at the University of Strathclyde from 18 to 22 July 2022. This conference follows previous events at Cambridge (2021), MIT (2020), Oxford (2019) and Leiden (2018).

HYBRID FORMAT

The conference will be fully hybrid, that is, it will be possible for both the audience and presenters to participate remotely over Zoom, if preferred.

REGISTRATION

We are asking in-person participants to register and pay a nominal registration fee of GBÂ£20 (about US$25) at the following link:
https://onlineshop.strath.ac.uk/conferences-and-events/science-faculty/computer-and-information-science/5th-international-conference-on-applied-category-theory-act-2022
If the fee is a financial burden for you, please contact us.

Online attendance will be free, although we ask that you nevertheless register using the above link. This will allow us to keep track of the numbers of participants, send out zoom links, etc.

The university's covid regulations change unpredictably, and we still don't know what the capacity of the room will be. In the event that we are over-subscribed, we have some side rooms where participants can watch the livestream together while still participating normally in coffee breaks etc. The reason for the registration fee is to give us the option to limit participation if it becomes necessary, and if that happens then places will be first-come-first-served except for accepted speakers.

FINANCIAL SUPPORT

We have a budget for financial assistance for participants thanks to our sponsors, for which priority will be given to accepted speakers, PhD students and early career researchers. Please contact the organisers if this would be useful to you, including information about your status, and your estimated costs.

Financial support application deadline: Friday 10 June 2022 Anywhere on Earth
Financial support notification: Monday 13 June 2022

TRAVEL AND ACCOMMODATION:

Central Glasgow has many hotels and Airbnbs, but can be busy in the summer months. The conference will be held in the McCance building on the Strathclyde campus:
https://www.openstreetmap.org/way/86419875
The nearest hotel is the Premier Inn, about 30 seconds walk away.

Glasgow is well served by trains in the UK (e.g. London Euston is 4.5 hours away), and can be reached from the European continent via a Eurostar train to London. Note that advance train tickets can be considerably cheaper in the UK. Glasgow has an international airport, and is also quite easily reachable from Edinburgh airport.

We look forward to welcoming you in Glasgow!

-- The organisers
Jules Hedges (jules.hedges@strath.ac.uk)
Fredrik Nordvall Forsberg (fredrik.nordvall-forsberg@strath.ac.uk)
Jade Master (jade.master@strath.ac.uk)
James Fairbanks (fairbanksj@ufl.edu)
Question: what does the 'camera-ready' deadline entail? Is it just that after that date the files on EasyChair will be linked on the website?

Yeah, polished versions of the papers will be hosted on the conference website. "Camera-ready" is technically a lie, the actual camera-ready versions for EPTCS will happen some time after the conference

Reminder: Sunday is the last day to register for in-person ACT. Also for online please register (for free) if you want to get sent zoom links
https://onlineshop.strath.ac.uk/conferences-and-events/science-faculty/computer-and-information-science/5th-international-conference-on-applied-category-theory-act-2022

By the way, a tentative program is now available for ACT2022!

I get to give a talk at 6 am on Monday. :tada:
(Because I have the misfortune to be in California.)

There is now a dedicated stream for the conference and related events

#conference: ACT22
Make sure to subscribe if you're attending--virtually or not! We plan to use it for all conversations regarding talks and social gatherings
Will I get a zoom link in my email? I'm giving my talk virtually, and it starts at 6 am Monday my time, so I want to know what I'm doing.
We are sending out the zoom link today to everyone who registered!
It's going to be hot for ACT2022:
Those are literally ideal temperatures to me! Lol
Yeah, as global warming proceeds Italians are going to take over Europe like an invasive species. :smirk:
In Portugal, down south in Alentejo, temperatures could reach 46-47 Celsius. :hot:
That is too hot even for me. I thrive until 36 Celsius, give or take :smile:

Christian Williams said:

Where will recordings be posted?

The recordings of the first 2 days have been posted in the Applied Category theory Youtube Channel LINK
